Such a beautiful property! I was fortunate to find Judy and George’s property available last minute for our family vacation.
The tree farm is large and beautiful with many birds and butterflies flying about. You may hear a mockingbird sing through the night. We also saw deer most every evening. It is a working farm, so you will see a couple workers tending to the trees and driving through the farm. They were not a bother to us, as we were not to them. A friendly wave and a smile then we all continued on our way.
The farmhouse was clean and very spacious for my wife and I along with our two teens and two dogs. There is fast WiFi and a large television that we were able to stream movies on. We enjoyed taking the golf cart down to the river bank and explore. Evenings were spent having a campfire and eating s’mores.
As for the area, it was perfect for what we wanted to do. Cumberland Caverns is literally just down the road. Ruby Falls and Rock City is just over an hour drive to Chattanooga. The drive to Chattanooga was beautiful as it takes you through the mountains and has some breathtaking views. We also went to the Jack Daniels and Nearest Greene distilleries which were also just over an hour away.
George was helpful and answered any questions we had in a timely manner. Especially the one which my wife asked wanting to know what type of tree sits in front of the farmhouse.
If you’re looking to get away and want to unplug in a peaceful setting, Judy and George’s place is highly recommended!

We had such an incredible time at Judy & George's place. My husband and I (along with our lab-mix) met my parents, who were traveling from Texas, at the tree farm for a little COVID-friendly vacation. The place was very easy to find and absolutely beautiful. Our dog loved running around the tree farm and chasing butterflies, and we all enjoyed walking the property and attempting to fish down by the river. We did rent kayaks one days for a 3 hour kayak down the Collins River which is something I'd definitely recommend. If you have any questions or problems, George is incredibly responsive and very friendly - one of the best AirBnB hosts I've had in that regard. Overall if you, like us, are looking for a quiet, clean, and pretty place to relax for a few days and escape, this is perfect.
Some more detail: the accommodations are exactly as pictured and VERY clean. The entire place is very cute and perfect for a family vacation. The rooms are well appointed, beds are comfortable, and the A/C worked amazingly through several VERY hot days. The internet was very good and we were able to stream several live baseball games, which are often a test of streaming capacity, without issue. The living room in particular is very comfortable and has plenty of seats and is where we spent most of our time. We also found the dining room table, which is quite large, perfect for board games. I luckily did not need to work while there, but if something had come up I would have been fine (as noted, the internet was great and for calls, I have Verizon; service is slightly more limited for AT&T).
We cooked all of our meals during our stay, and found the kitchen basic, but sufficient. The fridge and freezer are roomy and work well, and the kitchen is well stocked with dishes, cups, and silverware. There are two cutting boards. Some packing tips for future guests: if you are planning on cooking anything complex or have a recipe that needs precise measurements (such as baking), I would recommend packing measuring cups/spoons - there are not a whole lot of those (at least that we could find). You might also consider packing a good cutting knife and/or some of your own pots and/or pans if you are particular about those; the ones at the AirBnB work ok, but are a little on the dated side.
Like I said above, overall we really enjoyed our stay. The farm is beautiful and the hosts couldn't be nicer. Thanks again Judy & George!

There’s a place to park right up next to the house, a whimsical stone path that takes you to the front porch, and a dreamy white picket fence that surrounds the property. The kitchen and bathrooms were fully stocked and made me feel like I was at home. There’s a nice gas stove/oven that we used to cook, along with a charcoal grill on the back deck where I grilled a steak while enjoying the beautiful yard and watching my husband play a little disc golf. There’s an awesome fire pit in the yard that I hope to use next time, but we had rain. The kitchen also has a dishwasher 🙌🏼 and full size fridge, lots of dishes, bowls, glasses for water or wine, utensils for cooking or eating, pots and pans, a toaster, a nice coffee maker, and I think I even saw a crock pot in the cabinet. They left us a loot of snacks and the pantry had plenty of seasonings and essentials. The best part of the home for us was the living room. The fireplace is full of romantic pillar candles you can light, and there’s an array of lamps you can use depending on your mood. We cozied up on the cute chairs and played a few records while enjoying the ambiance. I loved finding new pieces of art all over the home, especially the giant chalkboard in the kitchen. There’s books to read for the young and old, and a few toys for kids, but they were so perfectly tucked away in plain sight that us 30 year olds didn’t even notice. And just when we thought we had taken full advantage, we found a battleship game in the closet. The rooms were so cute and cozy! We stayed in the master bedroom which has an attached bathroom that hosts a claw foot tub. The bed was comfy and the pillows were great! There’s also a little table with chairs and an adorable boho hammock on the deck around the left side of the house where I sat and watched the sunrise through the trees. I wish we could have stayed longer because I felt so at home, but nicer.
Thanks to Caleb for the clear communication and for making sure we had everything we needed, including the code for the door. You guys are awesome hosts! Until next time.

I like to start off positively, in doing so, I will say that Sofie's Place was incredibly clean, and fit with ample linens! Treats were left out for my boys, which felt like we were going to see a relative, and that was nice! Donna was also flexible with us changing our reservation.

Cons:
1) Uncomfortable beds, which led to back pain.
2) Hot water issues in the bathroom past 3-4 mins of use (which I didn't realize until the end of our stay, due to taking a bath, instead of my usual quick shower),
3) The Family Room got very cold, making it impossible to utilize.
4) Missing kitchen essentials, which we purchased a lot of.
I would not stay here again. Even though we are very courteous, we were walking on eggshells due to the novel of house rules, which felt like we were being talked down to e.g. "don't abuse the stove." Had I received this "novel" with more notice, we would have found other lodgings, but everything was already rented. Also, we were asked to tip their housekeeper.

Literally nothing to complain about. Great host. Book with confidence! 🤗

review_text: I WISH I could leave 10 stars.This house exceeded my expectations. I dont know where to begin.The house is outfitted for real life. We brought a lot of stuff and didn't even need it. So many airbnbs claim to provide things and then you get there and find out they lied or the things they provided are suboptimal. This place was stocked like I STOCK MY OWN HOME. The knives were sharp. A keurig AND a coffee pot. Several varieties of coffee. Lots of spices, condiments, butter, sugar, everything! There were flashlights and bug spray. Extra blankets and pillows. So many towels. The towels were so nice.I'm actually on amazon now looking for those big white bath towels with the attached hook for drying for my OWN house. It rained most of our stay. So we weren't able to take any of the water toys out but they were there! We enjoyed the deck. We grilled. I don't think the listing mentioned the firepit, but they have a LOVELY firepit with TONS of wood and lots of chairs. They even have the sticks for roasting smores. I cant say enough about how much I ENJOYED my stay. It was only an hour and a half drive from our home in Nashville. The host was SUPER responsive. Responding to my messages within minutes. Honestly I don't have a single bad thing to say about this place and I have been staying at airbnbs for over 5 years. I have had some terrible and some fabulous stays with airbnb. I i have even hosted my own airbnb. I'm a neat freak and I cant tolerate dirt, dust, or loose hair on surfaces &/or floors. So my standard is pretty high. This place was clean as a whistle and I really hated to leave when the time to checkout arrived. If this place is available on the dates you're looking for a house on the water, BOOK IT! You will be so glad you did.

We brought our own kayaks and decided to drive a couple miles to a campground on the other side of the river that had boat ramp access for $5. McMinville is nearby if you need groceries or want to eat out. We visited Fall Creek Falls State Park, kayaked as far as we could go toward Burgess Falls (hiked the rest way to the amazing falls due to low pool), and kayaked and hiked to Twin Falls in Rock Island. This area has some of the most beautiful waterfalls we have seen. Cumberland Caverns is close by and a must visit. This home is a good value.
